file_content.text: I hope your meeting with the Master was enlightening.
The Master's ready to meet you.
The Master will complete your lessons, and you'll be welcomed as a full member of the Order of Revan.
This is a great privilege. The Master reveals himself to no one outside the order.
Where do I find him?
I'll go now.
I promise, I won't abuse your trust.
You won't regret this.
At last--the respect I deserve.
I earned this.
You may go to the Master in his chamber. He will be waiting for you.
Listen to him. Obey him. Through the Master, you will know the path of Revan.
Well. You really made it, didn't you?
I've being hearing about your progress--hearing about your trials. Your initiation hasn't been an easy one.
But you met the challenge and showed you can walk Revan's path. Now you may undergo the final rite.
Is this where I speak to the Master?
Do I finally meet your leader?
Yes. You've earned your audience.
I'm honored.
What a pain.
This won't be a waste. This time you're ready.
There's nothing else I can do for you until you've finished the trials. Talk to the other teachers. They'll help.
Around you, you'll find your new teachers--Revanites who have spent their lives recovering the works of Darth Revan.
Speak to them. Complete the tasks you are given. When you are through, return to me, and the Master will give you your final lessons.
Did you lose your way in the jungle? You have my sympathies, but we can't help. We have no food or water to offer.
There's nothing for you here, and strangers are not welcome in this place. You'd best be going.
I'm not leaving. I'm here to join the Order of Revan.
I'm looking for the Revanites.
I'm afraid I don't know what you're talking about. Or--
I was given this token. Does it tell you anything?
I have something to show you.
I'm not sure--
Ah. You do have the token. Someone must have had great faith in you to send you our way.
Welcome to the Order of Revan, initiate. Welcome to your new life.
Why didn't you say you were a Revanite in the first place?
Why the paranoia?
You must know by now that our ways are secret. We have enemies who believe we should be silenced.
Stand aside.
I thought I made myself clear--but you had your chance. You must leave immediately.
Wait. You're carrying the token!
Heh. Welcome to the Order of Revan, initiate. Next time, identify yourself--we must protect ourselves.
What is this place?
Where are we?
I'm looking for the Revanite leader. Am I talking to the right man?
Are you in charge here?
Ha! No, I only guide initiates along the path.
You're no threat to me.
Perhaps. Perhaps you'll humble us all. But now is not the time for that.
This place is our haven, built by the Master and protected by the faithful. Here, we leave our duties to the Empire behind.
This is where the Master guides us in the mysteries of Revan--the one who began a Jedi, but grew into a Sith... and then something more.
Why would a Jedi join the Sith? And what do you mean by "something more"?
What does that mean?
But who is the Master?
The Master?
Our leader, founder and teacher. Learn of Revan, and you'll learn about him.
There's nothing greater than the Sith--nothing "more" to achieve.
The Sith are absolute.
Is that right? The Sith are a path to power, but is the Sith philosophy where that path ends?
Sith history isn't my area. Why does this matter?
This is all ancient stuff.
We learn from those who come before us and gain strength from their triumphs and failures.
As a Jedi, Revan was a warrior who slaughtered armies. As a Sith, Revan was a teacher who trained a thousand dark apprentices.
Eventually, Jedi and Sith both turned on Revan. But instead of being destroyed, Revan was reborn.
What do you mean, "reborn"? What was Revan's final fate?
Reborn?
If all that's true, why isn't Revan known better?
Why is this a secret?
The Empire tries to bury Revan as a "minor figure" out of fear.
You're talking about a myth.
That's absurd.
It may sound like a myth. But it's true.
Revan was stripped of power, stripped of life, of memory--and left to rot. And still, Revan relearned the ways of the Force.
The reborn Revan destroyed Jedi and Sith and came to Dromund Kaas. Although Revan's life ended here, the Master preserved that life so that we may learn from it.
If Revan was a destroyer, then I will learn your teachings.
I sense the chance at power.
Your knowledge might prove useful.
I sense the chance at power.
I'm not Sith. What does Revan have to teach me?
How's this apply to my life?
You know I'm not even Imperial, right? This isn't my thing.
How's this apply to my life?
Sith or not, Imperial or not--Revan taught many people. Anyone can benefit from our work.
That doesn't explain why the Sith think you're heretics.
But the Empire hates you.
The Dark Council sees our beliefs as a threat to its power. Maybe the council's right--but if the council falls, it falls because it's weak.
I don't believe this cult is just about "learning."
You're not just historians.
We learn to be better, more powerful. Even though the Empire may not publicly support us, we believe in the Empire's ways.
Revan mastered the light side and the dark side--war and peace. We seek to walk the same path.
Take part in our rituals. Learn Revan's path to greatness. Succeed, and you earn the right to join us.
What do I have to do to meet the Master? I'm eager to speak to him.
How do I find your leader?
Then I look forward to learning.
Excellent.
We're not getting anywhere.
Forgive me if I've gone on.
You have no business in this place. I advise you to leave before harm comes to you.
